results.title: Language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines the child’s language process in the first four years, beginning with the development of phonemes, semantics and syntax. Looks at the process by which language is acquired and how that acquisition can be influenced.

results.title: Language - audience
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this final video of the series, the use of language is investigated, followed by a discussion on the importance of “audience” for the writer.

results.title: Language
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Robert Potter, David Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Language is the basis of all human interaction. The ability of human beings to use symbolic communication, particularly through speech and writing, to convey abstract thoughts is one of the most important of characteristics that distinguish us from the animals. This program explores biological, psychological and structuralist theories of language and linguistic development.

results.title: Landslides
results.brief_description: Landslides takes us on a breathtaking journey of discovery, into and through the human body, under the ground, into the outback, into the air, into outer space. It provides visceral shock as it probes body tissues and spaces, and cerebral delight as it weaves intriguingly around its central theme.

results.title: Landscapes from space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Landsat data being processed by CSIRO are revealing a new picture of mineral areas, the environment, agriculture and land use planning in Western Australia.

results.title: Landscape: a pattern of change
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Landscape can be looked at historically - the present pattern can be seen as the end result of previous land use. The film traces these different patterns through the history of a typical mid-western town in New South Wales, Mudgee.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Robertson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
